Key Arguments: The legislation threatens freedom of speech, a core democratic value.
Censorship could lead to a government-controlled narrative similar to authoritarian regimes.
Past government actions during the Covid-19 pandemic demonstrate the dangers of censorship.
The government should not be the sole arbiter of truth regarding misinformation and disinformation.
Public debate and discussion should be encouraged, allowing individuals to form their own opinions.
Notable Quotes: Freedom of speech is what makes Australia stand out from other nations like China and North Korea.
The government cannot be the sole arbiter of what is misinformation or disinformation.
People are not stupid. We can make up our own minds what is correct information and what is not.
